summary: This is an FBI complaint form documenting a mail complaint received on November 16, 2016, from an individual in Alta Loma, California, questioning why Jeffrey Epstein is not in prison and alleging he should be charged with unlawful sexual activity and child molestation. The complaint was administratively filed as a 'Zero File'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual referenced in the complaint, who the complainant states should be charged with unlawful sexual activity and child molestation.

events.title: Mail complaint received by FBI
events.description: The FBI received a mailed complaint from an individual in Alta Loma, CA, questioning why Jeffrey Epstein was not in prison and alleging he should be charged with sex crimes.

events.title: FBI complaint form drafted
events.description: An FBI agent drafted the official complaint form (FD-71) to document the mail complaint received about Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A member of the public mailed a complaint to the FBI on November 16, 2016, specifically questioning why Jeffrey Epstein was not in prison.
The complainant alleged Jeffrey Epstein should be charged with 'counts of unlawful sexual activity and child molestation.'

The FBI processed this as an 'ADMINISTRATIVE INQUIRY' and maintained it as a 'ZERO FILE' in an administrative room, suggesting it was logged but may not have triggered a formal investigation at that time.
The complainant's name is redacted in the document.
